Summary 20+ years of recruiting experience working as a Recruiter as well as Managing a Recruiting Department. I have expertise in full-life cycle recruiting, sourcing support and working on diversity initiatives. 
I have extensive experience recruiting for the following roles: 
TECHNICAL (Software and Hardware Engineers, Design Engineers, Test and Validation Engineers, Automation Engineers and IT Professionals) 
SALES (Outside and Inside Sales Reps, Sales Engineers and Business Development Reps) 
EXECUTIVES (VP's, Directors, Managers) 
HEALTHCARE (Customer Center Reps, Supervisors and Administrative) 
As well as - Marketing professionals, co-op's/interns, and Executive Admins) 
 
I pride myself in building and maintaining relationships with my Internal clients (Hiring Managers) as well as my external clients (Candidates). 
 
Experience in finding passive and active candidates through networking, LinkedIn, resume mining, cold calling, career events, University relations and events, employee referrals etc.

Sourced 12 key hires for Legal and Government affairs in first 6 months of employment while ramping up to learn the corporate culture and business group acumen. Built template library for candidate prescreening questions for implementation of the Taleo talent management solution. •	Utilize multiple recruiting sources and advanced sourcing techniques to identify, attract and interact with passive candidates. Create a comprehensive plan for establishing and nurturing talent pipelines in alignment with dynamic business needs.

 Software Engineering Recruiter Aerotek May 2011  –  January 2013  (1 year 9 months) Portland, Oregon Area Aerotek® Inc. is a leading provider of technical, professional and industrial recruiting and staffing services. We are part of Allegis Group® Inc., the second largest staffing company in the United States.  
•	Recruited information technology professionals for a variety of contract projects for Fortune 100 and 500 companies including application developers, project managers, web developers, network administrators and firmware engineers. 
•	Coordinated with the Regional Recruiting center and other local offices to cover Software Engineering roles in the Pacific Northwest. 
•	Negotiated wage rates and other terms and conditions of employment 
•	Evaluated candidates’ strengths compared with clients’ needs by phone screening, personally interviewing each candidate and checking professional references. Setting up technical interviews or technical exams when necessary.  
 
 Manager of Staffing Services Corporate Technologies LLC March 2008  –  May 2011  (3 years 3 months) Management of Professional and Consulting Services for a well established, 28 year old, Technology Company. Primary focus is to maintain and develop new long-term business relationships with new and existing clients, as well as manage and oversee the recruitment team on a National basis. Responsibilities include; assist in the recruiting of candidates, continually building Corporate Technologies’ client database, determining client needs, submitting the “best fit” candidates & closing sales as well as negotiating contract rates and fees for placements and developing strategic proposals. Responsible for negotiating total hire package for Corporate Technology candidates that are placed on contract or directly placed at a client site as a full time employee, and act as, liaison between clients and candidates throughout the contract and/or hiring phase. Client Recruitment Executive Corporate Technologies LLC May 2007  –  March 2008  (11 months) Responsible for recruiting technical engineers for small to medium sized Value Added Resellers (VAR) throughout the US. Transportation Solutions Division (TSD) is focused on the vision to "deliver a safe and smart driving experience". Transportation is a vital element of the IoT, creating and consuming connected data to entertain and inform while improving efficiency and safety 
Responsibilities 
The Transportation Solutions Division (TSD) is seeking a Platform Solutions Engineer. You will be responsible for enabling and supporting the Intel Atom Processor in embedded In-Vehicle-Infotainment (IVI) solutions. You will be enabling Tier1 and OEM automakers with device drivers and software stack components on Linux distributions. Technically, this will require the ability to modify the kernel, debug issues, integrate and/or port drivers and applications, and to work within the open source community.  
 
The following qualifications would be added advantages:  
-Demonstrated development experience with embedded OS environment, especially on IA-based System On Chip (SOC) platforms  
-Deeper knowledge of software in at least one of the following areas: Linux kernel, Driver porting, 2D and/or 3D graphics, security, video encode/decode, display technologies, low-level system software, I/O, software debug  
-Experience in HW debug, specifically active participation in board bring-up  
-Experience working with Tier 1 OEMs (and field representatives) and experience creating 'customer ready' collateral and training  
-Experience working with international customers  
-Experience with drivers at a debug level 747559 - Software Engineer Intel Corporation November 2014  –  November 2014  (1 month) Shannon County Clare, Ireland As an Software Engineer, you will work with Intel Shannon DCG/CSIG Software development team to deliver leading edge enterprise and communications platforms that will enable tomorrow’s Data Centre infrastructure and accelerate cloud computing adoption from high-end co-processors for supercomputers to low-energy systems, as well as solutions for big data and intelligent devices. 
You will be based in Shannon, Co. Clare as a member of a talented team of software engineers with a broad range of experience. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with multi-site projects working on cutting edge hardware. Required skills 
•	Honours degree in Computer Engineering, Electronic Engineering or Computer Science. 
•	Minimum of 3 years software development experience. 
•	Excellent knowledge of C/C++ programming, especially in developing multi-core or multi-threaded software. 
•	Strong knowledge of Linux operating system, Linux Device driver development and how to optimize for performance. 
•	Good problem solving skills coupled with a strong aptitude to learn and innovate. 
•	Good understanding of Intel Architecture/x86 or other multi-core processor. 747870 - Digital Verification Engineer Intel Corporation November 2014  –  November 2014  (1 month) Shannon County Clare, Ireland In this position, you will be a member of the silicon design team at the Shannon Design Centre. This silicon design team is involved in the design, pre-silicon verification and layout of leading edge Intel Architecture products. The team is looking for digital verification engineers across a range of experience levels who have RTL development and Pre-Silicon Validation skills although experience in adjacent engineering disciplines such as Software development would also be considered.  
 
Your responsibilities will include but not be limited to: 
•	Responsible for the pre-silicon functional verification of complex digital designs 
•	Implementation of functional verification environments (Test benches) 
•	Development of test plans & test cases. 
•	Implementation of checkers, random test generators, high level transactional models and bus functional models (BFMs) 
•	Performing simulation, random and focused stimulus generation and coverage analysis 
•	Develop architecture and micro-architecture knowledge of the complex digital design block(s) under test 
 
Required skills 
You should possess at minimum an honours degree (level 8 on www.nfq.ie) in Electronic Engineering or equivalent.

- Experience of position within industry 
- Background in the pre-silicon verification of complex ASIC, SoC or FPGA designs

Summary Intel is always hiring! Check out our latest opportunities at intel.com/jobs! 
 
As the Campus Relations Manager for UC Berkeley, UC Davis, UCLA, Virginia Tech, Cal Tech and Sacramento State. I visit each year to engage the top students in a dialogue about their careers and how Intel Corporation might be a fit. 
 
Most of our positions are filled at the graduate level. CS/CE/EE are our core disciplines, as well as some ChemE, Material Science, Chemistry and Physics opportunities. 
 
If you, or someone you know, fits this profile, we welcome the chance to chat with you.
